modules.description: Translates the [@@cold] attribute into a set of compiler directives that prevent inlining, local optimization, and specialization. Works with OCaml's attribute syntax and compiler directives. Used to mark functions as non-optimizable for precise control over code generation and debugging.

Expands a custom attribute into one or more additional attributes, modifying the AST during ppx processing. It operates on Parsetree.attributes, transforming them based on predefined rules. This is used to inject additional metadata or alter behavior at compile time.
